Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • Robot

  • public abstract class Robot
extends java.lang.Object

      Create a new Robot

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected boolean canMove(Direction d)
      Can the Robot move (one "spot") in the given direction?
      protected boolean haveBeen(Direction d)
      Has the Robot already been to the location in the given Direction?
      protected void move(Direction d)
      Move the Robot (one "spot") in the given Direction (if possible)
      void powerOn(java.lang.String room)
      Turn the Robot on
      void printMap()
      Print the map (in its current state) "0" indicates a wall, " " indicates a location that has been visited, and "." indicates a location that has not been visited

      Set the delay (in milliseconds) between moves
      abstract void start()
      Start cleaning/moving
      void stop()
      Stop moving/cleaning

    • Constructor Detail

      • Robot

        public Robot(boolean show)
        Create a new Robot
        Parameters:
        show - true to include a visual simulation of this Robot

      • Robot

        public Robot(boolean show,
             int delay)
        Create a new Robot
        Parameters:
        show - true to include a visual simulation of this Robot
        delay - the delay in miliseconds between each cleaning movement

    • Method Detail

      • canMove

        protected boolean canMove(Direction d)
        Can the Robot move (one "spot") in the given direction?
        Parameters:
        d - The Direction of interest
        Returns:
        true/false if the Robot can/can't move

      • haveBeen

        protected boolean haveBeen(Direction d)
        Has the Robot already been to the location in the given Direction?
        Parameters:
        d - The Direction of interest (relative to the current location)
        Returns:
        true/false if the Robot has/hasn't been to the given Direction

      • move

        protected void move(Direction d)
        Move the Robot (one "spot") in the given Direction (if possible)
        Parameters:
        d - The Direction to move in

      • powerOn

        public void powerOn(java.lang.String room)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Turn the Robot on
        Parameters:
        room - The file containing the simulated room
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An issue encountered with the room file

      • printMap

        public void printMap()
        Print the map (in its current state) "0" indicates a wall, " " indicates a location that has been visited, and "." indicates a location that has not been visited

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay(int delay)
        Set the delay (in milliseconds) between moves
        Parameters:
        delay - The delay (in milliseconds)

      • start

        public abstract void start()
        Start cleaning/moving

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop moving/cleaning
